p: This result is consistent with the previous reports ( Mohsin et al., 2016). The decrease in the droplet size might be the result of more surfactant being available to stabilize the oil-water interface. It is more likely with SNEDDS formulations that the larger the surface area, the faster and complete are the absorption rate of drugs ( Mohsin et al., 2016). Furthermore, the decrease in the droplet size represents the formation of a unique close-packed surfactant film at the oil-water interface ( Table 2), there by stabilizing the oil droplets ( Gershanik and Benita, 2000; Pouton, 2000).
